meanings.definition: Misken (verb): to misunderstand or misinterpret something
meanings.sent1: I miskened her message and thought she was upset when she was actually happy.
meanings.sent2: Don't misken my intentions, I was only trying to help.
meanings.sent3: He miskened the joke and ended up laughing at the wrong part.
meanings.sent4: The fog can misken the distance, making objects appear closer than they are.
meanings.sent5: It's easy to misken someone's tone in a text message.

meanings.definition: Misken (adjective): mistaken or incorrect in understanding or judgment
meanings.sent1: She gave a misken answer on the quiz and lost points.
meanings.sent2: His misken belief led him to make the wrong decision.
meanings.sent3: The misken map led them to the wrong location.
meanings.sent4: Her misken assumption about the situation caused unnecessary worry.
meanings.sent5: The misken directions caused them to get lost on the hike.
